website_summaries.verdict: An ideal option for enthusiastic little helpers who just can't resist hijacking your vacuum cleaner every time you pull it out. Real suction makes this a win-win for moms and kids.
pros: A realistic design with keen attention to detail offers kids a convincing miniature version of the real thing
Sounds, spinning beads, and light suction satisfies discerning kids who want an authentic cleaning experience
cons: Small on/off switch can be difficult for little hands to operate

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Our son, 1 1/2-years-old, is OBSESSED with vacuums and carpet cleaners. He has nearly broken my vacuum a few times because it's a bit too large for him to maneuver. We got him this for Christmas, and it was the only gift he cared about. He wouldn't open any other gifts after getting to it. His sister had to do the rest of them. He has been "vacuuming" for 4 days straight. When I vacuum, he follows along side me with it. It is a lot quieter than I expected. The sound doesn't get annoying. I love it! If it ever breaks, I'll buy him another.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie

customer_reviews.title: Refunds are a joke. Defective toy
customer_reviews.text: Received this vacuum and gave it to my son for Christmas. He was so excited until I could not get it to work properly. I put two new sets of batteries in the vacuum and both times it stopped working within a minute. The way it rolls is terrible and not at all smooth. The on / off button is reversed. Now I have been fighting for my full refund since Dec 27th. For some reason they gave me $10 less! They seem to be responding to my emails when they feel like it. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: DeEpDaYdReAmEr

customer_reviews.title: It’s the perfect size for him
customer_reviews.text: Cutest thing! My son showed interest in the vacuum, so I decided to buy him his own. He now goes around the house with this vacuum! It’s the perfect size for him.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Suction
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my friend told it had real suction. My son grew tired of “pretend” toys and wanted things that actually worked. The suction on this is horrible if you are looking for that as your main reason for purchase. Had to buy my son a real Dust Buster instead
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Burrier

customer_reviews.title: The toy was defective and would not turn on
customer_reviews.text: I correctly installed 4 C sized batteries and turned the switch to on. Nothing happened. The product was defective and non-functional upon arrival. I returned it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Auto.Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t suck up like advertised. You have to turn on two separate buttons to make fully functional which doesn’t make for easy use when teaching a toddler to turn on and off fully. One switch turns the suction while one button turns the “swirl” feature of the colored balls being thrown around in the clear canister. Both are noisy and one ends up getting left on by toddler and im constantly having to go find the vacuum and having to turn it off myself. Very annoying it’s not just one simple button. Also doesn’t suctions anything at all. Rolled it over big and small pieces and can barley feel suction on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby Carr

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality of product that was sent.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived broken, it was obviously returned previously. The handle will not stay in place and the confetti only turns occasionally, which is just annoying but on top of it, it was supposed to be a birthday present. Super disappointed that Amazon would allow this. A new one was sent out to me and within a week the confetti in the front stopped turning. I had hoped it was just the batteries but they were changed and no difference. Overall just a bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Bundrant

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I had written a four star review previously because of how much my child loves this toy. I bought a second one for my friend's kid and it broken after a few uses. Unfortunately my friend didn't tell me this until after the window to return the product and now they have a broken toy. I am still happy with the vacuum my son has but clearly this product should be made with better quality. I can upload a picture later but the toy broken by the on button and there are wires sticking out. I'm sure she could glue or tape it back together but you should not have to do this with a brand new toy.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza McManus

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Splurge
customer_reviews.text: My girl uses this every time I am vacuuming. She doesn't care about he simple vacuuming features this has, she mostly likes seeing the "dirt" spin and the flexibility it has just like her parents'. Our younger child also enjoys playing with this. I bought this because it was a realistic play-house toy that's not bright pink. I wanted my children to have a set of their own house tools for imitating mommy and daddy.
customer_reviews.author: Cassius Clay Rae

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: If your little one loves the vacuum, this is a must have! My son is 14 months old and is literally obsessed with our vacuum... he is quite big for his age, 31lbs and 34inches tall so he is able to handle it decently! Took him a few days to warm up to it, but now it's all he wants to do! So glad someone decided to make a realistic toy vaccum. It even picks up cheerios. I should also note that it's held up to the handling of a 1 year old boy quite well too.
customer_reviews.author: April Rae

customer_reviews.title: Save your Money
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't tell if this was defective when we received it or broken, but this toy was terrible! The piece that kept the batteries in place fell off repeatedly, the front piece broke off in about a week and had to be taped back into place. Eventually all of this went into the garbage after barely a month of use because we were just sick of dealing with it.
customer_reviews.author: KaterBels

customer_reviews.title: Cute but disappointed in the "real" suction
customer_reviews.text: It's very cute and my son loves to 'vacuum' but it has the suction power of you breathing in over the crumbs. Don't expect to send your kid in there and actually clean up the mess. Also, the head of the vacuum flips around and I have found that a toddler gets very frustrated with that. Lastly, there is a button to make the confetti part spin around BUT there is a second switch you have to turn on for the 'suction' part to work. Otherwise it's very cute but don't expect it to do actually do any work.
customer_reviews.author: Eryn M

customer_reviews.title: Avoid - Cheap plastic, breaks easily. Child Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas gift for my toddler and broke the first day. Very upsetting as he was quite excited and seemed to really like it. The handle doesn't stay attached which will cause the bottom to fall if picked up. This is what happened in our case and the when it fell the bottom piece snapped off. It is made of cheap plastic and doesn't hold up well. Maybe a $20 toy at most, and doubt I would even buy it again at that price.
customer_reviews.author: aftx

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work well, sound gets stuck on and won’t shut off
customer_reviews.text: It’s cute how but the button stopped working consistently after the first week we had it. it gets stuck on the vacuum sound and you have to turn off the bottom switch instead of the button. It seems like for the price it should be able to come off. I should have just gotten a real dustbuster for my toddler to use honestly. I probably wouldn’t recommend this to anyone. When I went to write this review I found out it is supposed to have real suction.... that’s hilarious to me because you don’t notice anything! It doesn’t work and now my toddler asks to use my vaccuum since his “isn’t working” It was a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't sweep up anything
customer_reviews.text: This was a big disappointment I bought for my grandkids my grandson loves to sweep but it doesn't pick up any dirt at all but I kept it because he loves pushing it around on my floors it makes a little noise like a real sweeper but thats all it does it was way to expensive but keept it because the grandkids like it it says in the description that it picks up small thing but it doesn't pick up anything
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine Sievert

customer_reviews.title: This has to be a joke!
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be a joke. I ordered one last week, installed batteries and it would not turn on. I ordered a replacement one, delivered today, installed batteries according to the instructions and it is not turning on either. No idea why this is the second one I ordered and it’s not working at all. I’m very disappointed for wasting so much of my time on this.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea poor execution
customer_reviews.text: We thought that this would be a good gift since my toddler likes to help me with everything around the house. When I'm trying to vacuum he tries to grab our vacuum so he can help which obviously can make cleaning a challenge so this seemed like a perfect option to have him feel like he was participating without getting in the way of the actual work. It's cute but the noise scares my toddler and it's not built to stand upright on its own so it is constantly falling over and becoming a tripping hazard. It's a pain when trying to help my toddler clean up his toys and this keeps falling over.
customer_reviews.author: LadyAtTheGate

customer_reviews.title: waste of money don’t buy it!look for another instead!
customer_reviews.text: not only the handle of the vacuum always comes off!so annoying!it’s so small probably good just for 2yrs olds and so flimpsy the bottom part always turns!!and i bought this cause it said it can vacuum a little bit when they play with it eeekkk wrooonng!so false!2stars because my toddlers loves it despite me wanting to throw it away already!and they love mimicking me when i’m vaccuming but yeah fraustrates me because the damn handle always comes off and always asks me to fix it while im vacuuming so thank you who ever made/designed this clearly they don’t have any child!
customer_reviews.author: Elise D. Dela Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not durable.
customer_reviews.text: A fun toy for toddlers! My little one has enjoyed this toy for several months until the flat section at the bottom broke off completely at the swivel joint. We crazy glued it a couple of times but it continues to break off. It was fun while it lasted. It's simply not strong enough to tolerate impacts when a child hits the wall or furniture while playing.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Cute idea but not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my toddler because it advertised having real suction. I didn't expect it to pick up like an actual Dyson but this has no suction at all, it just makes a lot of noise. There are 2 switches, one makes the beads inside whirl around and controls the sound effects. The second one is for the "suction" and its hard to find. It's difficult to maneuver too so my kids just don't play with it. I should have saved some money and bought a cheap toy vac from Wal-Mart or a real handheld vac would have been a much better idea. It is cute though, looks just like my full size vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Smith

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in how cheap this is. My son got one for Christmas and it would only turn on sporadically, just enough for him to not forget that it was supposed to make noise. Just got a new one and the balls don't move around and the whole thing just feels cheap. He's not a very delicate vacuumer and I have no doubt that it will be completely broken soon.
customer_reviews.author: tbs

customer_reviews.title: So cute and little one loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Little one loves to touch the regular vacuum so bought them this one and they love it. Knocked off a star because the pieces swirling around seem to get stuck and not move which takes out a bit of the fun. It does suction, but don't expect them to be able to clean the house with this. The standing mechanism can be difficult to engage, but we just sit it up against the wall. Batteries seem to last forever even though it's left on for long periods of time swirling (not suctioning). Overall, excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sayuri

customer_reviews.title: It's not as great as everyone made it out to be
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it's no better than the cheap Walmart ones you can get the only difference is this one looks like a real Dyson. It couldn't even suck up pepper flakes off of the floor but it does great at sucking up hair balls sort of
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum is a super cool concept but did not meet my expectations. Visually looks very cool but... does not suction very well, like at all. Just a teeeeny bit of dust & 1 dog hair after vacuuming the entire house lol. & it runs out of battery super quick. My daughter is still pretty young so she could care less but I didn’t think it was worth the money. Maybe $15 would be better. Save your money & buy a used one if you really want one.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum toy is very cute, but it is not well made. The batteries keep popping out although there is a screw that is supposed to hold the battery door. The handle doesn't click in place & keeps coming off & broke after the vacuum tipped over on the floor. Very disappointing. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: NY Girl

customer_reviews.title: Love but weak power
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his vacuum! And he bangs it around and it has yet to break or damage. Very sturdy. The power is very low and I don't know if it's suppose to be that low. One power button turns the suction and sound on. The other power button turns the beads on that fly around which also has very little power to make the beads fly around. But you can NOT run both together. So it's either noise or fun beads. Also it says it suctions, but it has yet to suction anything. It is battery powered but I'm shocked of how weak the power is. Maybe there is something wrong with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Mills

customer_reviews.title: Cute in theory but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to give my twin toddler boys each one of these for their birthday. They are obsessed with vacuums and I thought this would be perfect for them! Well.. this is very cute and it looks like the grown up version. But the handle falls off quite easy, it doesn’t stand up very easily and I’m not sure why it advertises it actually sucks up stuff. It doesn’t. I’m ok with that, it wasn’t why I bought it. My boys like it. It’s cute, but just kind of annoying with the handles coming off and it constantly falling over.
customer_reviews.author: Peczka

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum is really great. I got it for my son last Christmas and he (and his brothers) still play with it regularly. It has held up well, which is a testament to how well it was made as three little boys have put it through the ringer. It has two 'power' buttons on it. One in the back for the vacuum sucking sound--and it actually does suck, folks. It can suck up the little balls it comes with--and any other small items on your carpet. The other power button is on the front and it causes all the little balls to fly around in the canister. Really fun toy!
customer_reviews.author: Boymom

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Worked for 5 minutes. Then power was up and down. The kicker was that it wouldn't shut off when using the 'off' switch. Had to take out the batteries for it to turn off. This is being returned. Rather overpriced for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within a couple weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is so adorable and my son is obsessed with vacuums. He was super excited about it but unfortunately the vacuum already stopped working. The little container with color foam pieces doesn't move anymore because of all of the static in that container The suction no longer works even though we have only turned it on less than a handful of times. The handle routinely pulls out and the wheels almost never sets correctly so that my son can stand it up. I'm surprised by all of the amazing reviews given the lack of quality but perhaps I got a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: B.C.

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My kids really enjoy playing with this toy, especially alongside mommy when she's vacuuming. When it says "With real suction" don't expect much though. It's not very powerful and will only pick up crumbs the consistency of glitter. I am also not confident that it's very durable. I am curious to see what happens If it gets dropped down the stairs, or on the hardwood a couple of times. However, the role play affect is great and my kids still love it because it looks like the big vacuum. I'm glad I got it on sale and didn't pay full price.
customer_reviews.author: hobbitchick

customer_reviews.title: Cute but flawed.
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this, since my son absolutely loves any vacuum. This will give him something to do so I can get the vacuuming done faster than letting him "help" me. But there are a couple issues. First of all the handle will not stay on. It's supposed to be a snap in that would never come out. But it comes out all the time. We've tried prying the little tabs out a little bit so it would fit tighter but it still come off. Also, my house is not especially dry, but there so much static that the little beads that are supposed to swirl around in the pretend collection cup are just stuck to the sides...
customer_reviews.author: Shelly8

customer_reviews.title: Rip off !
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my 2 year old nephew who is completely fascinated by vacuums - it keeps him occupied on hardwood flooring but on carpet it is completely useless! He literally throws it away & gives it zero attention. I think the sound is what he likes (oddly) another con is the it the fact that it didn’t come with batteries or have any sort of back up power , & after a couple hours a day. I get the “aunty.... need battery” calls.. save yourself the trouble & get a cheaper real vacuum from Walmart! My nephew is now a proud owner of a dirty devil from Walmart. Less stress & the kid loves it
customer_reviews.author: Shaday

customer_reviews.title: Awkward
customer_reviews.text: This could be great, but it’s awkward. The part that’s supposed to be the “brushroll” won’t stay on the carpet and it flips around. It doesn’t stay upright very well. I don’t personally own the real dyson so maybe this is how the real thing is, but it’s pretty annoying. My son gets very mad at it.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but doesn't actually suction
customer_reviews.text: My LO loves this! There is a small amount of suction but barely. Not enough to even feel when you stick your hand up to it. I was expecting more based on the headline and the reviews I had read. It barely picks up anything. A couple pieces of dog hair at best. But it looks nice and is a fun teaching toy for the LO's. I like this kid vacuum better than other kid toy vacuums because it looks realistic. I am only disappointed in it not being true to the advertisement and description.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Original and Replacement never worked
customer_reviews.text: We got the first one and put brand new batteries in and it didn't work. So they sent a second one and asked for the first one back. This one has the exact same problem. So we're sending this one back as well and getting a refund. Which sucks because it was a birthday gift from grandma and my son is extremely upset because he was so excited and loves it. It would be great if they would have a # that I could call that actually connected so I could troubleshoot and try tinkering to get this second one working. I emailed and haven't heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I’m assuming most people get this for their cleaning obsessed toddlers, like we did. Cute idea, and our two year old still likes it. But for a little more money, I could have just gotten him a stick vacuum or a dust buster that actually does a little more cleaning. It’s TINY too. I knew it would be, but when the box arrived and it was small enough to fit in our mailbox, I was a little shocked. Cute. But a little expensive for what it does. Also our handle falls off constantly
customer_reviews.author: pistol007

customer_reviews.title: Not cracked or broken; it fell apart in less than 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: NOT BROKEN. Just fell apart. The screws there are not long enough. My son played with it normally. He did NOT abuse this. Every time we vacuumed he also did right next to us. He used it the way a vacuum is used and it just fell apart. So sad because it's literally his favorite toy. Very disappointed didn't even last a month.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Really cute and realistic looking, but it's irritating that ...
customer_reviews.text: Really cute and realistic looking, but it's irritating that it doesn't come with batteries. I would seriously pay $10 more if a toy came with batteries. Also, the handle (according to the directions) clicks/snaps into place. It doesn't. Maybe I got a defective one. I hot glued it in place, so it would stay instead of returning/exchanging. Ain't nobody got time for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the Dyson. The color is a a nice yellow. Flimsy. Suction hole is about 1 inch. Meaning it barely picks up anything and the kids will have to try and aim it to pick up things. Even with aiming, you may be off because of the hole size. My 18mo old and 2.5 year old did not enjoy the toy. I guess they were expecting to be able to actually help clean.
customer_reviews.author: Linh Duong

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Its junk.
customer_reviews.text: Really overall displeased with this toy. I didn't really have high Hope's from the get go but my daughter loves to imitate me while we vacuum and do chores. It's a toy it keeps jamming up and not rolling properly, the little balls that float around must be foam or something they are now all stuck at the top and don't move. I've tried shaking it and all. Overall we have it two weeks and my daughter has lost interest because it's not functioning properly and really I'm already ready to pitch it. WASTE of MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen K.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. It's his new favorite toy. Its durable enough to handle his crazy toddler tendencies to smash everything into other things and the pretend power button that moves the little beads in the chamber makes a sound that he loves. But if you were hoping that it would actually be a help with the vacuuming, then you will be disappointed Im afraid. It has zero suction power. Not sure why they even have the switch. It makes noise, but that's about it. I wasn't really expecting much for that aspect. I'm just glad my kid loves it and that it keeps him busy.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle A Dodge

customer_reviews.title: Cute but should be priced lower! Doesn't suction.
customer_reviews.text: My year son is obbessed with our vacuum so we got him this loves it already! Cute but alot more cheaply (feels cheap) made then I expected for the money and the brand. Doesn't suction much if at all but the noise makes it more real for the little guy. Also nice and lightweight!
customer_reviews.author: Misty M

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: Slightly overrated product. It makes me mad that I paid $55 for this right before Christmas and then it drops down to $25. Definitely not worth the $55 I paid for it. Don’t waste your money unless it’s under $25. It’s not that special!
customer_reviews.author: Keep Calm and Carry On

customer_reviews.title: Great for younger toddlers!! 1.5-4’ish age ranges!!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and fun for the little ones who like to me their parents big helpers! One suggestion, don’t connect the arm or the handle until you’re ready for it to be permanently put together! I began putting it together to then gift wrap and wasn’t thinking that disassembling it would be a “no-go” once put together. I wouldn’t suggest this for the serious or avid little cleaners though - really more of a toy for the younger toddlers!! My almost five year old daughter I’ll outgrow this probably a bit faster then I will like but great toy for the child that has everything!!
customer_reviews.author: Zerry James

customer_reviews.title: My nephew loves it, it's his fav, even over Elmo.
customer_reviews.text: LOL, my great nephew is 23 months old and he LOVES, LOVES, LOVES to clean, so I purchased this vacuum for him for Christmas, it was his go to on Christmas morning first pick out of over 25 items that I purchased for him. By the middle of the next day, I had to replace the batteries. Totally worth the money I would buy this again and again, hands down his favorite toy. If you're on the fence get off and get it! You won't regret it. I would recommend this over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Cotton

customer_reviews.title: Pint sized fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my toddler grandson who always wants to push around my vaccum cleaner when he's here, and it's too heavy for him. This is perfectly sized for him and the buttons are easy for him to push to turn off and on himself. It's not too loud and moves easily over our carpeted and hardwood surfaces. It doesn't always stand upright when you stop pushing and have to play around with it to get it balanced and standing up. I haven't noticed anything being actually sucked up but the floors are already cleaned when he gets here. It's shorter in height than I expected but certainly a good size for a toddler still.
customer_reviews.author: DL Turner

customer_reviews.title: Sad: (
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for my 5 year old son after he became obsessed with it at a play center that had a few of them! He loves it, and it really does have suction which we all thought was hilarious. I was just about to order another for my nephew from this seller until I realized that they DOUBLED the price since I ordered a little over a month ago! Sad :(. but great product!
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: These are not all created equal
customer_reviews.text: I think we got a knock off version. I purchased because my son loved one at a cousins house. The one we received is much lower quality, it does not suction at all (and our cousin’s does). It also won’t stand upright on its own, there is a clicking that I believe is supposed to lock the wheels, but it doesn’t catch. Kind of bummed we got a crappy version. The box was in labeled on the outside, not the same as some of the boxes pictured in reviews. So either we got a knock off, or this company is making a much crappier product on purpose.
customer_reviews.author: spaghetti321

customer_reviews.title: For vacuum lovers and patient parents
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it but still prefers using real vacuums. He's 2. He ends up turning it on, playing for a minute or two, then setting it down with it still on. Ends up draining the batteries and makes an annoying sound. Trying to teach him to turn it off when he's done but not there yet. It takes 4 c batteries so you probably want to get so rechargeable batteries. Plus he can get a little aggressive with it slamming it into the wall and furniture. Use with caution.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dee

customer_reviews.title: Cool for a few days
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift from Santa and at first it worked fine. I was surprised that there was actually some suction. After a few days the front button no longer works so there is no spin action. I can't get a replacement that's new now on Amazon which is very disappointing. Edit: Magically after leaving the review, I was able to get a replacement for this product and I've updated my review by 1 star. If this one lasts longer than 2 days, I'll reconsider.
customer_reviews.author: I Love Everything

customer_reviews.title: Paying for a Name
customer_reviews.text: Unimpressed. My son loves to vacuum so this seemed like a great toy for him. Unfortunately it came with all kinds of little pieces that were supposedly able to get sucked up from the suction on the toy. This did not happen and resulted in extra mess to clean up. The vacuum also had poor battery life. For a toy that costs as much as this one I expected much more. I could have bought one of the cheap plain vacuums and my 2 year old would have liked it the same. You are simply paying extra for the name stamped of the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Fun but breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: My kids have liked this vacuum. It looks realistic and makes fun sounds. The suction doesn't actually work, but that's not a big deal. We originally bought this toy vacuum in 2014 and it broke within a month. It broke toward the bottom where the flat part is on the floor. Amazon replaced it since it broke so quickly. Now after 3 years, our replacement broke in exactly the same spot. Since it has broken twice in the same spot, I am convinced the design is just poor. We are now on the market for another toy vacuum, and it will not be this one - I would like to find something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: It's tiny small and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! The cheaper ones on Amazon have been better. My daughter loves to pretend vacuum. She had vacuums she wore out after many sets of batteries. Saw this one and the reviews were good. But it's junk. First of all it's tiny. The smallest toy vacuum we've had so far. It makes no noise at all and the suction doesn't exist through the tiny hole in the bottom. Daughter thinks it's cute and lined it up with her others but otherwise I would have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: JCB

customer_reviews.title: fun toy
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the real stick vacuum so I got this for christmas for him (he is 2). He loves it and can turn off and on both switches himself (two switches, one for actual suction and one for the spinny toy on top). Suction is pretty light and will pick up a few crumbs but not even really worth mentioning. Deducted a star since handle will not click in and stay and I had to tape it. But a great toy that he loves. Everytime I get out the vacuum he gets his. So cute. Also it makes a little noise but is not loud at all (I hide that obnoxious popper toy he has).
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaBrown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: Really really cute toy. Very well made for something that is plastic. My 3.5 year old loves it and it is the perfect size. Requires 4 C batteries. The wind tunnel spins little bits of confetti stuff and the suction part makes a satisfying vroom sound when turned on. And to my surprise theres an actual dirt compartment lol. Overall super pleased. 10/10 would recommend, especially if you are in need of a new toy during quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: A must-buy for every home with a little child!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't beginning to tell you how much I love this little toy. After seeing my little boy following me around everywhere with his toy chair.(pretending it was a vacuum) I decided to go online and do a little research for something cute/realist for my kids. I actually came across this little gem, and boy, I can guarantee this will be a hit for the next few years. My kids range from 1 to 7 years old, and they constantly fight over who is going to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Linh Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 16 month old son who loves to pretend clean. Pros: No assembly Lightweight Not noisy Ball spin easy to activate Surprisingly realistic Cons: Batteries not included Has separate on switch that my toddler can't figure out The rolling part at the bottom twists easily Suction is so light that I thought we had a defective model until I found one hair in the clean out compartment. 1 hair after hours of vacuuming in a house full of cats = suction that is not worth speaking of My son loves pretend vacuuming with this even when it's not on so that's a win for us. I would recommend this product for little cleaners!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute you vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This product is so cute! If it was based off looks, I would give it 5 stars! My son loves to help clean and thus vacuum is perfect sized for him (almost 2). It does have real suction, but nothing strong enough to actually pick up anything so I was sad about that. The only other downfall is that the base/ wheels can go all wonky when he starts to push it and occasionally the front end flips upside down which makes him upset but it's still a very darling toy vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: Ehimmelman

customer_reviews.title: So cool for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: How cute is this little "Dyson". My 14 months old is obsessed with my full-sized dyson vacuum. To the point where it's impossible for me to vacuum with him in the same room. He wants to touch the vacuum and take it out of my hands! This adorable machine let's him feel like he is a part of the cleaning process. There is minimal suction but the fact that it does in fact have any suction at all is pretty cool. I wish there were more thingys (foam squares maybe?) in the canister but there are enough to catch his attention. Overall we love it!
customer_reviews.author: meagan

customer_reviews.title: Happy baby happy mama
customer_reviews.text: The suction is okay. It really does suck stuff up but the hole is so small to get sucked up into literally like the size of a quarter. But it doesn’t stand up correct I have to either lean it on the wall and then it clicks into place but that’s been pretty irritating. Overall for the kids sake it’s great they always want to help this makes them think they’re helping a lot even tho it’s only a little. Happy baby happy mama
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: No real suction.
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler loves it, it hasn't gotten broken with all of her play. The only negative is that it says it has suction when really it doesn't have enough to pick anything up. I'll not expecting her to do actual cleaning but when we got this one it was because it said it had real suction and I thought it would be more fun for her if it could really pick things up. That's a little disappointing, otherwise it's a very cute toy.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 year old LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: My 1.5 year old is obsessed with this vacuum. He played with it even before we found C batteries for it, and now that it makes a noise he won’t stop. Only downside is that the whining noise it makes gets annoying. He leaves it on and goes to play with something else, but if I dare push the button to turn off his vacuum he runs back and turns the noise back on 🤦🏻‍♀️ It’s not loud at all, just not what I want to hear all. Day. Long. Overall it’s great, well made, and totally worth the price for the hours of play we get out of it.
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Once we put batteries in it it started working. It's very loud which I can get past however the on/of switch was broken so it wouldn't turn off. We had to take the batteries out to turn it off and I can't let my kids play with it because we can't put the battery cover back on. This was a huge disappointment. He was so excited to get a vacuum for his birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea H.

customer_reviews.title: Cute Product / No Cleaning
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is super cute and my 1yo LOVES it. However, the "suction" quality doesn't actually work. The product also takes 4 "D" batteries at a time, so factor that into your cost estimates for the product (an extra $10 - $40 over the life of the toy). The colored confetti doesn't move or anything either. However, like I say, my Toddler is obsessed with it so I don't regret the purchase. If I had a do-over I'd probably just give it "as - is" and not bother with the batteries. Same smile level for the kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 Year Old Approves
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this about an hour after unboxing because my son has not put it down since. The details are very cute and it’s easy for him to maneuver around my house and he especially loves that it looks just like mine. He debated skipping breakfast over playing with this. If only the suction was strong enough to clean my entire house... however I will be able to vacuum alone now which is a win and the entire reason I ordered this.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS VACUUM
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves to do whatever Mommy is doing. We bought her this so she could vacuum when her Mommy does. She loves this vacuum compared to a different model we had bought her because it is more realistic. It makes sound, the balls move around the entire time she is vacuuming and she can actually suction some things off the floor. Keeping in mind this is a kids toy and very inexpensive. LOVE THIS VACUUM.
customer_reviews.author: Eganbunch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy for a little vacuum lover
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our grandson who loves vacuums. He is 10 months old and can push this thing around like a champ! It can actually suck light weight stuff into the collection box. The colored pellets spin and make additional vacuum noises. Highly recommend but realize it doesn't suck like an actual Dyson. If you are planning to start a child labor camp in your home, you will need a more powerful vacuum. If you are not a psycho and just want a toy, this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Abe Dedek

customer_reviews.title: Really vacuums.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old and he absolutely loves it. It does actually work but you have to go over the item your trying to vacuum very slowly. He loves emptying the canister and as seeing how he helped clean! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Wight

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old really likes this.but I think its super annoying that it will not stand up right so it takes up a lot of space laying on the floor or has to lean up against things. Doesn't actually have enough suction to pick up anything. Update. Now the plastic beads don't spin around inside the tank anymore. It makes the noise but the beads are all stuck to the sides with static.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this! It does suction and mimic a real vacuum sound. It seems pretty durable too, he kind of smashes it into things a lot and it hasn’t failed us yet! 😅 excellent price! My only complaint is the handle comes off if you pull it hard enough. It doesn’t seem to want to snap in place and stay. Not a dealbreaker though, as he doesn’t pull it hard enough for it to come out when he uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina D.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best toys I’ve ever purchased for my toddler. He’s not 3 yet but the suction power is gentle enough that I’m not worried about it. I can actually get laundry and dishes and cooking done because he loves it so much and he’s moving while he’s playing! Be aware that it does not come with batteries and it needs 4 C batteries. I would not buy this with the intent of cleaning up actual messes. It has just enough suction to be fun for a kid, but it’s not meant for cleaning up, that wouldn’t be safe anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than the original design
customer_reviews.text: If you never owned the original design you will probably be happy with this vacuum. But my kids had the original Dyson design and when it broke we replaced it with this. This is so much smaller and less durable than the original. I was really disappointed, as were they. It will be fine, they will use it, although less as much than they would have if it were larger because they've basically already grown out of this own. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Edwards

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter loves this thing.
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter really likes three things about this toy vacuum. First, it looks like a real vacuum. Second, it makes authentic vacuum noises. Third, it actually will vacuum up small light things. It also has the whirling beads inside the transparent canister to simulate dirt. I fear it will eat a lot of batteries, though, if she turns on the actual vacuum function too often, or forgets to shut the thing off. But, all-in-all, a very realistic toy.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin J Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: For those who are disappointed that it doesn't actually vacuum -- IT'S A TOY! For toddlers. Before Christmas, when I asked my daughter what her 2 1/2 year old likes to do, her answer was, "Make messes." So, mostly as a joke I got him one of these for Christmas. It was the biggest hit of the day even without batteries. Every time one of his older brothers tried to play with it he took it back. No, it doesn't suck up junk. No, it doesn't stand up on its own. Why would you want a toddler to have easy access to a fist full of dirt? And toddlers never put things away neatly anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Carolzozs

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed toddler
customer_reviews.text: my Son loves to vacuum and won’t play with a toy vacuum anymore. He wants the real deal so when I saw a dyson I was pretty excited for him. Well this thing is a joke for $35. The suction power is weaker then a hand held dust buster and it broke within 2 minutes of him using it. Wasn’t being aggressive at all. It’s very poorly made. The floor part snap right off. And as any parent knows you can’t give a 20 month old a toy and then take it away to return it. I’m trying to superglue it and hope for the best
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie Amador

customer_reviews.title: Suction never worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 18 month old for Christmas, he absolutely loved it, but the suction would never even turn on. I wanted to exchange it for another one, but this was not an option, they just gave me other productions to choose from as possible exchanges. Then I looked into returning it and buying a new one, but the price had gone up from about $28 to $40 for the cheapest new version. My son loves it so much we can’t just return it without replacing it and I don’t want to pay that much extra for a new one. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Naman

customer_reviews.title: Our son loves it
customer_reviews.text: We weren't expecting or anticipating the vacuum to work at all (it hasn't ever picked up anything) so don't be planning on that! Our son loves to vacuum with me and we often vacuum every single day. It's fun because he is really learning to love and enjoy it. He gets excited when I pull out the vacuums. The only thing that drives me crazy is that there is a top button to turn on some little "confetti" type stuff and all of our confetti stuff stuck to the sides as soon as it was turned on. It never spun around and it's just been stuck like that since then. But it's been fun and our son has loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Could have been a little more durable for the price. 1 year olds can be rough on things. The handle won’t seem to stay in anymore and it hasn’t even been a week. The two back wheels that are for it to rest don’t work right either. My son loves this as long as the real vacuum isn’t out. So it was a temporary fix. Would recommend looking at this as the last resort if nothing more durable is available.
customer_reviews.author: zena

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy, overpriced. Pictures NOW correctly depict toy.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. Endless fun for her. However- when we ordered it about 4 weeks before Christmas it was marketed to look more like a miniature functioning vacuum. The pictures we saw reflected the central section now filled with colorful balls is where the debris would go. Just like a full-sized vacuum. The price even reflected this. It didn’t look quite so toy-like. If we had understood that, if that had been much more clear, we would have bought a full sized Dyson or something else.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca O'connor

customer_reviews.title: A kids Vacuum that works.
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest little toy. I was so sick of my kids playing with my expensive shark vacuum, so this was a good buy. It also surprisingly enough has pretty good suction they have picked up some little lightweight items. The kids ( 2 & 1 years old) have a hard time locking up the back wheels and keeping them up, but its not that big of a deal. It is quite noisy on hardwood floors although and sometimes drives me up the wall. Minus those two things my kids enjoy it! The older kids have even fought to use it.
customer_reviews.author: H Family

customer_reviews.title: Big on cuteness.. Short in durability
customer_reviews.text: was Really excited to find this for my 3 year old nephew. It’s an exact replica of the full size version and the fact that it has suction was a bonus. Loved the little balls that spin around to add to the realness. The downside is that it seems very cheap. While not broke (yet) I’d imagine an accidental step on it or hard bang into a wall will end this little cutie.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Salts

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a great purchase for my 16.5 month old daughter! She loves it and drags it with her everywhere. The real suction is a nice feature, not enough to really vacuum anything . But what can you expect it's a toy. I read other reviews saying it didn't stand up alone, but I haven't had that issue and it stands alone just fine. Would buy again! Only thing I'll say I don't like, Is how easy the bottom/suction area thingy flips over. If I didn't help my daughter flip it back over, I think it would end up breaking at some point. Only thing I don't like, otherwise good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CnD917

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My girls love it, both 1 year old and 4 year old. Do not expect this to actually do any cleaning, it really is just a toy. But it sucks up enough dirt and hair that my oldest can see and feels like she's actually doing some cleaning. (It really only gets some dust and a few hairs unless you're really trying). Overall cute product, and nice to have a real vacuum look rather than the sing/song style.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Cute toddler vacuum- don’t expect functionality
customer_reviews.text: Wish that it worked more than it does, I loved the idea of a functional toy. Sucks up a minute amount of dirt. Little dirt catch was challenging to use- no way our daughter could open it on her own. That being said, she loves turning it on and helping me clean. Wish there was only one button to make it functional. The button that’s easy for her to push is for the colorful confetti, and there’s a switch in the back that she can’t move herself to operate the sucking function.
customer_reviews.author: Jenlea

customer_reviews.title: Best buy ever!
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month old hasn't let go of this item since it arrived! He is obsessed with out vacuum and can even turn it on and off, this product has avoided many a melt downs since he can't always play with the real thing. It does take 4 C batteries so just be prepared for that!
customer_reviews.author: Critic 1234

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Update: This sadly didn’t last. Our toddler grandson somehow managed to snap off the little brush assembly and it’s now broken and cannot be repaired. Unfortunate because it was his favorite toy. :( Purchased this for our toddler grandson for Christmas. He absolutely loves it (looks just like my Dyson!). Has held up well to daily play. Every kid who comes to our house plays with it. A winner!
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: Cute but doesn’t actually vacuum much
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cute vacuum for my 2-yo. I gave it 3/5 stars because I expected it to pick up more debris when I read the product information. It basically doesn’t pick up anything. Good things: it looks and sounds like a real vacuuum so my daughter loves it and “helps” me vacuum. There are little colored balls that float around in the bin that dirt/debris would go. Over all, it’s a good toy but don’t expect it to actually vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea but not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea however I was expecting the suction to be stronger and the container to be bigger. The suction hole and dirt container was pretty small, no larger than 2". At the end of the day it's still a toy. I was expecting a fully functional vaccuum for my kids to help out and have fun at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not that great
customer_reviews.text: It's cute but not really worth the price. I thought the suction would be a little stronger but it's not. The beads in the middle are suppose to spin around when it's on; only about half of them do. Some times the head flips around and she ends up scraping our floors with the hard plastic so we have to keep an eye out. Cute but not very practical play toy
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Batteries are expensive, not the best product for a kid who wants to use it all the time.
customer_reviews.text: Product didn’t come with batteries. It cost $10 just to put batteries in it because they are the really big batteries (C batteries I believe?) My son wanted to run it all day, every day. So he ran out of batteries by a week after Christmas. He didn’t like that it didn’t suction well. We ended up returning it and buying the Bissell perfect sweep turbo, which is an electric carpet sweeper. We just left out a piece of the handle so it is his size. It’s rechargeable and actually picks up Dog hair and lots of other stuff. It only costs $10 more, which you save in batteries anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old loves to clean. He has this out every time he sees a mess. So cute with the little balls that spin around to look like dirt being sucked up. Has a separate button for the spinning ball feature and a separate button for the vacuum feature.It does suck up a little and we empty the little cartridge when hes finished. It moves around really well when hes pushing it and light enough for him to carry. Doesn't really stand up on its own unless you really push to snap it into place which is frustrating for him, but its a great vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona25

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My kids all love it. Got for my one year old son who adores it and helps momma tidy up daily . Love it and so happy with purchase. Would definitely buy again and recommend. It actually does pick up trash too which is helpful. My girls loved to entertain baby brother in his mission to vacuum kitchen living room ..rooms and yes even the shower .....lol
customer_reviews.author: Del

customer_reviews.title: Super cute
customer_reviews.text: Super cute. We all fight about whether we think it’s actually sucking up light debris or if it’s pushing it out of view. Either way, my nephew LOVES it. The bottom does tend to flip over a lot which frustrates my nephew but that makes for cute entertainment on my end. It’s pretty durable considering my nephews has a heavy hand. All in all I’m happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Rossignoli

customer_reviews.title: Dyson mini
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum is super cute and just like the real thing. Claims it actually sucks stuff up however not very true. Maybe a small string or piece of hair every once in a while but my son tried cleaning up his cheerio mess ( he stepped on one and turned it to dust) it didnt pick up any of it. Does make noise. Has 2 buttons one for noise and spins the balls and one button for turning the suction on. A bit on the cheap side for quality. The bottom how it stands barely stands and also rotates a complete 360 which if its upside down will not stand up too well.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Works Well for a Child
customer_reviews.text: The suction on the thing isn't that great.. might pick up a speck of dirt after being run over about 10 times. Obviously too much suction and there could be some problems.. so it's probably better this way (though it seems kind of pointless to have such a function then). The bottom portion of the vacuum doesn't lock into the upright position like it should so you have to prop it against something while not in use. It's for a kids who will most likely not care about either of the above mentioned things, so I'd say go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Pittiemom13

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum fun!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is in love with this little vacuum cleaner!! It was easy to install the C batteries. The features are realistic I love that it sounds like a vacuum but it’s not loud like one. The little balls pretending to be dirt is adorable and at the push of a red button they move around just like the dirt and dust in a real vacuum cleaner. This can standup by itself which is great and it’s easy to push and move around for my walking toddler. I like that you have a choice to have the “dust” move or stand still. Great little toy for toddlers!!
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Yes - it works but not enough to make a difference!
customer_reviews.text: My 18-month-old received this as a Christmas gift. It’s been a hit! There are a couple different controls to turn on sound. One is a large red button, which is easy for him to push to turn on but the other is a switch which he can not control. Regardless, he loves this toy and pushing the on button! As I mentioned in my review title, the vacuum actually sucks up dirt BUT the amount it sucks up is so insignificant that this shouldn’t be used as an alternative to an actual vacuum cleaner. It’s still fun tho!
customer_reviews.author: MMBH

customer_reviews.title: Not what its cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it actually vacuums if you put a very large crumb right over the intake. Otherwise, it doesn't actually suck things up which was a big disappointment to our kid. It also doesn't stand upright by itself. The wheels don't pop back into quite the correct position to correctly support the vacuum. Nice idea, horribly executed.
customer_reviews.author: jmorton

customer_reviews.title: Best toy vacuum ever made!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best toy vacuum ever made. I mean, it REALLY vacuums and it's a toy! Wish they had this when I was a child...all I had was a toy carpet sweeper and yes, that was a real sweeper but, c'mon. A toy carpet sweeper can't rival this! This Dyson vacuum also has (2) different settings - one that makes a low vacuum noise and blows the little foam beads about inside the clear container part of the vac and the other, operates the real vacuum. Anyway, my toddler loves this and uses it whenever I vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: catbert

product_meta.title: Casdon - Dyson Ball Vacuum TOY VACUUM with working suction and sounds
product_meta.description:
Color:Grey/Yellow/MultiThis toy Dyson ball Vacuum is a direct replica of the instantly recognizable life size version - so role play really is just like the real thing! With working suction, it actually picks up small bits of paper and there's a removable debris drawer at the back. The Cyclone action with colored balls whizzing around the clear cylinder, the realistic sound and the 'twist & turn' Movement make this brilliant toy just the job for little helpers to help clean up! 

height: 25 inches. 
requires 4 x c batteries (not included). 
please note the suction on this toy will pick up small pieces of paper or polystyrene balls.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Little ones adore role play and pretending that they are doing jobs around the house – just like the grown-ups. This Dyson Ball upright vacuum cleaner has been specially designed to be true to life, right down to the last detail so your little helper will really feel part of your world while developing essential life skills. Casdons' Toy Dyson Vacuum is a direct replica of the latest “Ball” model. This realistic toy features a simulated cyclone action with colourful balls, so you can see it working. It also ‘Twists and Turns’ just like the real thing. This great toy also has real suction from the foot of the vacuum that is designed to pick up small pieces of paper waste or small poly beads. This links to a removable dustbin at the back, the child can easily take this out to be emptied and the cleaning can start all over again. Realistic role play for exploring imagination and developing social skills, Replica design with bright colours for visual stimulation, Play encourages the development of hand-to-eye co-ordination, Working suction and cyclone action for understanding cause and effect, Manoeuvrability of toy develops problem solving and motor skills, Independent play encourages exploration and discovery, true to life sounds for added realism and aural stimulation, Pre-schoolers learn by acting out and copying what their parents do, making the range of role-play toys from Casdon Toys ideal learning vehicles for youngsters wanting to emulate their parents. Casdons Dyson Ball replica is the best toy vacuum on the market. 63cm’s high 4 x C batteries required.
feature_bullets: Real suction picks up small pieces of paper waste or small poly beads for understanding cause & effect.
True to life sounds for added realism & aural stimulation.
Maneuverability of toy develops problem solving & motor skills.
Stylish! Exact replica of the latest Dyson Ball world famous vacuum cleaner.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars11,846 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
